problem_name: Symptom Management in Traumatic Brain Injury
description: Symptom management in traumatic brain injury (TBI) involves addressing the ongoing effects of brain injuries, particularly in patients experiencing persistent symptoms after a mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI). Effective management is crucial for improving the quality of life and facilitating recovery.
you_have_this_if: You are treating patients with persistent post-concussion symptoms.
Patients report ongoing headaches, dizziness, or cognitive difficulties.
You are looking for non-pharmacological treatment options.
Standard care protocols have not provided sufficient relief.
You are integrating adjunctive therapies into existing treatment plans.

approaches.best_for: Managing persistent post-concussion symptoms in patients with mTBI.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While nVNS is non-invasive and offers a novel approach, its effectiveness and acceptance in clinical practice are still being evaluated.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a non-pharmacological intervention for patients with persistent symptoms after mTBI.

start_here: Begin with Non-invasive Vagus Nerve Stimulation (nVNS) as it offers a promising non-pharmacological approach for managing persistent symptoms in TBI patients.
